chargeHist.descr: Physical Abuse of Elder Person - Intentionally Cause Bodily Harm
Physical Abuse of Elder Person - Intentionally Cause Bodily Harm

result.execSummary:
The defendant Tatyana R. Radtke was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Tatyana R. Radtke is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Tatyana R. Radtke was found guilty of Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Defendant will be eligible for expungement in 2 years.  Hearing scheduled.

miscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.
**  Pay supervision fees.
  Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Submit voluntarily to random tests of blood, breath or urine.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by your agent, which may include: alcohol/drug, anger management/DV counseling, psychiatric/psychological, AODA Assessment and follow-through with recommended treatment.  Actively search for employment, be employed or attend an educational institution or vocational training program.
**  Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.
**  If unpaid financial obligations remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.
  Defendant is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay the surcharge, notice given to def. in court.  May not possess any weapons, including firearms. Any violation of probation shall be reported to the Court at least 30 prior to termination of probation.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Tatyana R. Radtke

records.addlTxt: Count 2 dismissed on State's motion
SPD Case Compeltion
Conditions of Probation Imposed by the Judge
of DNA Collection at Conviction

01:51 PM   Attorney Dan Tombasco appeared for the State. Defendant, Tatyana R. Radtke, appeared with Attorney Benjamin L Schwarz.  Clerk N. Nobile.
MINUTES:   Victim rights compliance. Matter is resolved. The State moves to amend count 1 to Battery (940.19(1). An amended infomation will be filed later today; Attorney Schwarz does not object to an amended information being filed at a later time.  Defendant entered a plea of guilty to count 1; found guilty by the court. On State's motion, count 2 is dismissed. Court orders withheld sentence; defendant placed on probation for 12 months w/conditions. Any violation of probation shall be reported to the Court at least 30 days prior to termination of probation. 2 days sentence credit if revoked. Court costs ordered.  Defendant is ordered to submit to a DNA sample, notice given to def. in court. Appeal rights given. DE will be eligible for expungement in 2 years and Court will schedule a hearing today.  Hearing scheduled for August 15, 2024 at 08:30 am.
Fr: Court re: rotation.
Preliminary Hearing Waiver/Plea Offer

Defendant, Tatyana R. Radtke, appeared with Attorney Benjamin L Schwarz.  Attorney Alexandra Kathleen Smathers appeared for the Prosecution.  Clerk JT  Minutes:  DE waives preliminary hearing; probable cause found.  Case bound over.   Information filed, reading waived.  Not guilty plea entered.  Bond continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 11, 2022 at 01:40 pm.
Preliminary hearing on May 18, 2022 at 08:30 am.

130PM  Attorney Dan Tombasco appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney Benjamin Schwarz.  Clerk JT  Minutes:  Defendant requests preliminary hearing within 20 days; set before Commissioner on May 18, 2022 at 08:30 am.  Bond continued w/same conditions.  kmk
